channel.title: I need help with this illusion!
channel.description:
ok can anyone help me an tell me the answer to this illusion it is so freaking hard
http://dragon.uml.edu/psych/woman.html

item.title: I need help with this illusion!
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

I’ll try to explain this. It’s VERY EASY
You can see one or the other at first glimpse.
Now, the bigger eye, the one you can see wholly is the younger woman’s earring and or ear. Now, that first eye that only shows the lashes is the younger woman’s eyes, where are looking to the left, which makes it so you can’t see the rest of her face because she’s looking left. Now, Just imagine the face, without anything else. Do not imagine the hood, or the thing below the neck. The older woman’s nose is the younger woman’s chin. The older woman’s left ear is the younger woman’s nose. The mouth of the older woman, I think is the necklace of the younger woman.

THE EASIEST WAY OF FIGURING IT OUT IS:
COVERING THE OLDER WOMAN’S RIGHT WHOLLY EYE WITH A FINGER THAT WILL FULLY COVER IT. The main item that makes it look like an older woman, is the right wholly eye.

I don’t like the younger woman’s hair.

Now, let’s clear things up a bit:

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with this illusion!

item.title: I need help with this illusion!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

It’s an old lady, and then a younger lady/girl. I really have no way to explain it, but what you may see as the younger lady’s ear is in fact the older lady’s second eye.

Read full topic
